pr_title: GH-688: Added getLabel OptionalMethod for Optional

timeline.message:
GH-688: Added getLabel OptionalMethod for Optional

Signed-off-by: SakshiSaini17092 <sakshi17092@iiitd.ac.in>

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to check if v is an Optional - it always is (because that's the type of the argument) - though perhaps you could check that it is not null.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Yes I fixed that in my latest commit.
replies.author: SakshiSaini17092

timeline.bodyText:
I assume this is something that your editor has done automatically - could you change it? We don't use wildcards for imports.
If you are using Eclipse IDE, it's really easy to change this btw: go to 'Preferences' -> 'Java' -> 'Code Style' -> 'Organize imports', and where it says "number of imports needed for .*" set it to some very high number (99 for example).
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.message:
GH-688: Fixed the getLabel for Optional

Signed-off-by: SakshiSaini17092 <sakshi17092@iiitd.ac.in>
